text: Our big ambitious dream
is to basically build artificial general intelligence
of the natural world.
Baking in understanding of the physical world
and how we work and interact with the planet.
We're trying to conserve, protect,
basically restore different types
of natural world ecosystems.
What that looks like specifically is coastal communities
who strategically restore coastal ecosystems,
bringing back biodiversity to areas
that it's been declining.
Coastal Carbon is developing a digital twin
and a foundation model.
Our foundation model looks at all this wealth
of natural world data
and tries to learn a representation of it,
like visualizing all the seaweed
that exists globally in the world
and how we might strategically restore it.
What we're training on is actually
much larger than the internet.
Thousands of petabytes of 50 years of historical data
collected by satellites, both public and private.
We really needed a system that would scale
to accommodate for both, and then also a way
to learn a representation of all this data.
And that was really the big unlock
of working with AWS using tools like SageMaker HyperPod,
which allowed us to basically train
this really holistic understanding of the natural world.
What that enabled was being able to actually see underwater
from space for the very first time.
Coastal Carbon's wisdom is important right now
because the climate crisis is urgent.
We needed solutions yesterday.
And any minute that we can accelerate our understanding
of how to strategically apply resources
to fighting this challenge of climate change
is time well spent.
